power.title: Action Point
power.fluff: Digging into hidden reserves, you accomplish more than normally possible

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You can take an additional standard action.

section.name: Special:
section.text: Unless another ability tells you otherwise, you can only spend an action point on your own turn, and cannot use it to interrupt an action.

power.title: Administer First Aid
power.fluff: You tend to the worst of an ally's wounds, allowing them to catch their breath

section.name: Target:
section.text: One ally adjacent to you who has his or her second wind available

section.name: Check:
section.text: Heal vs. DC 15

section.name: Success:
section.text: The target can use his or her second wind without spending an action, but does not gain the usual bonus to defenses.

power.title: Aid Another
power.fluff: You cooperate with an ally to provide assistance

section.name: Target:
section.text: One ally designated as the lead

section.name: Check:
section.text: Skill check or ability check vs. DC
The DC is usually 10 + one-half the challenge's level. If the challenge's level is not known, use an Easy DC of the target's level.

section.name: Success:
section.text: The target gains a +2 bonus the assisted check. For most checks, the check must be started before the start of your next turn, and if it takes more than one action to complete, you must remain engaged for the target to retain the bonus.

section.name: Failure:
section.text: The target takes a -1 penalty to the assisted check. For some checks, the penalty can be avoided if the check is not started before the start of your next turn.

section.name: Special:
section.text: Usually, up to four creatures can use aid another to assist in a single check. In certain circumstances, the DM might decide that more or fewer creatures can assist. For example, only one creature can usually assist in picking a lock.

power.title: Aid Attack
power.fluff: You feint or distract an enemy, or otherwise help an ally's attack

section.name: Target:
section.text: One enemy

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Choose one ally. As long as the chosen ally can see or hear you, he or she gains a +2 bonus to his or her next attack roll against the target. This attack must come before the start of your next turn.

section.name: Special:
section.text: Usually, up to four creatures can use aid attack to assist in a single attack. A given creature can only aid a given attack once.

power.title: Aid Defense
power.fluff: You parry or shield block an enemy, or otherwise help an ally's defense

section.name: Target:
section.text: One enemy

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Choose one ally. As long as you can see or hear the chosen ally, he or she gains a +2 bonus to all his or her defenses against the target 's next attack against him or her. This attack must come before the start of your next turn.

section.name: Special:
section.text: Usually, up to four creatures can use aid defense to assist against a single attack. A given creature can only aid against a given attack once.

power.title: Basic Attack (melee)
power.fluff: You resort to the simple strike you first learned when you picked up a melee weapon

section.name: Target:
section.text: One creature

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage.

power.title: Basic Attack (ranged)
power.fluff: You resort to the simple attack you first learned when you picked up a ranged weapon

section.name: Target:
section.text: One creature

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Dexterity vs. AC, or
Strength vs. AC with a Heavy Thrown weapon

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 1[W] + Dexterity modifier damage, or 1[W] + Strength modifier damage with a Heavy Thrown weapon.

power.title: Break Object
power.fluff: You attempt to break an object with a well-placed kick or shoulder

section.name: Target:
section.text: One object
You cannot target items carried or worn by an unwilling creature

section.name: Check:
section.text: Strength vs. DC

section.name: Success:
section.text: You smash open a chest, burst bonds, force open a door, or otherwise break an object.
Smash wooden chest - DC 16
Smash iron box - DC 23
Smash adamantine box - DC 30
Burst rope bonds - DC 21
Burst iron chains - DC 28
Burst adamantine chains - DC 35
Break through wooden wall (6in thick) - DC 25
Break through masonry wall (1ft thick) - DC 35
Break down wooden door - DC 13
Break down reinforced door - DC 16
Break down barred door - DC 20
Break down iron door - DC 23
Force open iron portcullis - DC 28

power.title: Bull Rush
power.fluff: You force an enemy out of a defensive position or into a dangerous one

section.name: Target:
section.text: One creature smaller than you, your size, or one size larger than you

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. Fortitude

section.name: Level 6:
section.text: Strength +2

section.name: Level 16:
section.text: Strength +4

section.name: Level 26:
section.text: Strength +6

section.name: Hit:
section.text: You push the target 1 square, and shift 1 square into the vacated space.

power.title: Charge
power.fluff: You dash forward to launch an attack

section.name: Target:
section.text: One creature at least 3 squares away from you

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You move your speed. Each square of movement must bring you closer to the target.
You make either a melee basic attack or bull rush against the target, with a +1 bonus to the attack roll.

section.name: Special:
section.text: You can't take any further actions after charging, except free actions. This usually means your turn ends.

power.title: Coup de Grace
power.fluff: Sometimes there is no option to be chivalrous, only viciously effective

section.name: Target:
section.text: One helpless creature adjacent to you

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You use one of your attacks against the target. If the attack normally targets more than one creature or covers an area, it now only affects the target.
If the attack hits, it automatically scores a critical hit against the target. If the critical hit deals damage greater than or equal to the target's bloodied value, the target dies.

power.title: Crawl
power.fluff: Sometimes you just don't have the time to stand up

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be prone.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You move up to half your land speed.

section.name: Special:
section.text: If you are prone when an effect allows you to move a specific distance, you can crawl half that distance.

power.title: Drag
power.fluff: You forcibly move a creature you have a hold on

section.name: Target:
section.text: One creature grabbed by you, or one helpless ally

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. Fortitude
The attack automatically hits against a helpless ally

section.name: Level 6:
section.text: Strength +2

section.name: Level 16:
section.text: Strength +4

section.name: Level 26:
section.text: Strength +6

section.name: Hit:
section.text: You move up to half your speed and pull the target with you. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from the target, but otherwise provokes opportunity attacks as normal.

power.title: Escape
power.fluff: You muscle or wriggle out of a grab

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be grabbed, or affected by some other ability that allows an escape attempt

section.name: Check:
section.text: Acrobatics vs. Reflex, or
Athletics vs. Fortitude, or
Either skill against another specified DC

section.name: Success:
section.text: The grab or other effect ends on you, and you shift 1 square.

section.name: Special:
section.text: If you are grabbed by more than one creature or affected by other effects from multiple sources, you only make one check to end them all.
In such a case, use the highest DC and add +2 for each additional creature or effect, to a maximum of +8.

power.title: Grab
power.fluff: You seize your foe bodily to keep it from moving

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must have a hand free

section.name: Target:
section.text: One creature that is smaller than you, your size, or one size larger than you

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. Reflex

section.name: Level 6:
section.text: Strength +2

section.name: Level 16:
section.text: Strength +4

section.name: Level 26:
section.text: Strength +6

section.name: Hit:
section.text: The target is grabbed by you until escape or until the end of your next turn, whichever comes first.
If you are affected by a condition that prevents you from taking opportunity actions (such as dazed or stunned), you immediately let go of a grabbed enemy.
If you move away from the creature you're grabbing, or if a pull, push or slide moves you or the creature you're grabbing out of your reach, the grab also ends.

section.name: Sustain Minor:
section.text: The grab persist until the end of your next turn.

power.title: Run
power.fluff: You lower your guard to cover ground quickly

section.name: Effect:
section.text: Until the start of your next turn, you take a -5 penalty to attack rolls and grant combat advantage.
You move your speed + 2. Despite the name of this action, you don't always literally run. The action can include other movement modes such as climbing, flying, and swimming.

power.title: Second Wind
power.fluff: You push through the pain and fatigue

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You can spend a healing surge to regain hit points equal to your healing surge value.
You gain a +2 bonus to all defenses until the start of your next turn.

power.title: Squeeze
power.fluff: You move through a tight corridor, stand on a narrow ledge, or fit into a constrained space

section.name: Effect:
section.text: If you are Large, Huge, or Gargantuan, your size effectively decreases by one until the squeeze ends. For instance, if you are Large, you are effectively Medium during the squeeze. As your size decreases, you are leaving squares and can trigger actions such as opportunity attacks. You cannot reduce your size if you cannot move.
If you are Medium or smaller, the DM decides how narrow a space you can occupy.
Until the squeeze ends, you grant combat advantage and take a -5 penalty to attack rolls.
You move up to half your speed. While squeezing, the only movement that you can take is squeezing and teleportation.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You expand to your original size. When you do so, your new space must contain the smaller space that you just occupied. You are not leaving squares when you return to your original size, so you do not trigger opportunity actions.

power.title: Step
power.fluff: You move carefully to avoid giving a foe a chance to strike

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You shift 1 square.

power.title: Total Defense
power.fluff: Sometimes it's more important to guard against further injury than to attack

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You gain a +2 bonus to all defenses until the start of your next turn.
